sections.content: Someone was asking for 42Macro Data on the grids, so I'll throw it here
Welcome to the longest 'bear market' of all time

Note that prior to the backtests being broken down into factor classifications, BTC was the highest performing asset in every non-deflation regime. Its the sole reason why they had to break it down like this
In case this happens overnight don't freak out, its normal.
I can see something like this happening in the sort term, be patient
What the hell
Looks like it was a data collection error

Just realised an annoying conundrum I am in
Have been expecting negative behavior in stocks, and was planning on taking a massive short
but crypto-stock correlation is quite high right now
Means if I am right about stocks I might be wrong about crypto
What I need, therefore, is for the M-TPI to remain rock solid
34.8k is still in play imo
Just when you think there isn't any bearish data to find haha
What matters is what's most likely in aggregate
This is why systemization is so important

Due to the size and complexity of my damn portfolio I've only got about 50% the way through my sales. But at this moment I am tactically holding off on any further sales.
‎
All alts sold, a large proportion of majors remain
There will be no signal updates or analysis tomorrow. I will be at a War Room event all day becoming harder to kill. Best of luck my G's. I will return the following day
Distance between shorts and longs appears to be tightening up on the long side. This could be a short squeeze in the making
Mind you, it wouldn't be very large due to the short scale of the coinglass liqs

My levels of HEX hate are entering hyperspace
Bro I must be the only person on EARTH to have invested in hex recently, made money, and got out before the dump

well.... me and the students of course
Damn, liquidations looking heavy to the downside on coinglass. Looks like things have got very clear after the recent volatility has calmed down
This finally brings it in line with the expectation of the deantrader one

Closed for +34%
Not sure how to get the trade receipt.
Don't want to have any open positions while I'm sleeping

FYI this trade was a pretty high probability setup. Felt like cheating tbh. Would have gone up to 50x leverage but I was too lazy to bridge over additional collateral. Rookie move
Shows the importance of understanding liquidity maps
But its not just the one tool, its everything I've ever learned combined with the liquidity maps.

Going to manage my entries here
Haven't bought anything yet

good time to review these principles

The 4 "Off the cuff" rules of trading:

> 1. The choice not to participate is a luxury wasted on the greedy.
> 2. No one knows anything, and the only way to generate an edge is through systematically accumulated odds.
> 3. Patience in execution, furiousity in research. Its the quality of your system, not its speed, that matters most.
> 4. There are no such things as good or bad positions, only good or bad systems.
Rotated out of ATOM/DOGE into ATOM/MKR
bias for today is still down ironically
